page.title: 01ROOS DISTRICT-INTRODUCTION
page.content: The land around Roos and within our block is predominantly agricultural. The farming is mainly arable but some farmers keep livestock,such as pigs, cattle,sheep and dairy cows.The farmland is dotted with small copses of woodland kept by the farmers for cover of wildlife,such as pheasants and partridge.On the other hand many hedges have been grubbed up so as to increase the size of fields to accomodate large machinery,such as combined harvesters. The main settlement of people is in the villages of{ROOS}(850 persons) and {TUNSTALL}(less than 100 persons).Roos is a typical ribbon development along the main road to Hull and Withernsea. Tunstall is a small group of dwellings (mainly farms) close to the cliff top and the North Sea.
